intro: Seriphidium dubjanskyanum, commonly known as the Dubjanskyanum tansy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to harsh, arid conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Seriphidium dubjanskyanum is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
